channel.title: CVE Feed for Lexmark -- Perceptive Document Filters
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Lexmark -- Perceptive Document Filters

item.title: CVE-2016-4336|2024-08-06T00:25:14.496Z -- lexmark -- perceptive%20document%20filters
item.description: An exploitable out-of-bounds write exists in the Bzip2 parsing of the Lexmark Perspective Document Filters conversion functionality. A crafted Bzip2 document can lead to a stack-based buffer overflow causing an out-of-bounds write which under the right circumstance could potentially be leveraged by an attacker to gain arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2016-5646|2024-08-06T01:08:00.403Z -- lexmark -- perceptive%20document%20filters
item.description: An exploitable heap overflow vulnerability exists in the Compound Binary File Format (CBFF) parser functionality of Lexmark Perceptive Document Filters library. A specially crafted CBFF file can cause a code execution. An attacker can send a malformed file to trigger this vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2016-4335|2024-08-06T00:25:14.524Z -- lexmark -- perceptive%20document%20filters
item.description: An exploitable buffer overflow exists in the XLS parsing of the Lexmark Perspective Document Filters conversion functionality. A crafted XLS document can lead to a stack based buffer overflow resulting in remote code execution.
